value:
Beauty, ugliness... These exist only in
the eye of the beholder. No object's
essence bears trace of such things.

Humans are weak. Easily intoxicated
by power, they lose themselves.
...I, too, was human once.
I grow weary. Allow me some rest...

There is no me, no self to call mine.
I am only the chaotic web formed
between all those I have met...

My every emotion and memory
dissolved in a river of dark. I am
what remained. I am...nothing.

Gaining new strength... Some cause
for excitement, as I recall...

Neither good nor bad—as all
things are.

Weak results... Some cause for
despair, as I recall...

I am Bramimond. There is no me, no
self to call mine. My heart and voice
are borrowed, moment to moment.

Power changes a person. I've seen
the powerful go mad and persecute
the weak...$k$pDecline is not unique to humans.
Just as water runs downhill, power
corrupts—and warps.$k$pAnd yet, I have also seen those with
power fight for peace...and seek
equality for the downtrodden.$k$pAnd you... Would you protect those
beneath you? Or would you leave
them to fend for themselves?$k$pOnly those with power can decide
such things, and such power changes
a person... How will it change you?
I am Bramimond. What do you want of me, you who lives above ground?
Wah! What's that? A new form of play?
Were I to remove the seals, humanity would suffer.
The world? The whole world can burn for all I care.
We, the eight legends, once fought to defeat the dragons.
I've lived so long that finally, I have met one more curious than I...
There was a man much like you. His gaze never wandered. It was ever fixed straight ahead...
You should do as you like.

Ugh! What is that? A new form of play?
Humanity would suffer were I to remove the seals.
The world? The whole world can burn for all I care.

Humanity would suffer were I to remove the seals.
The world? The whole world can burn for all I care.
